title: Pharyngeal tubercle
text:
The pharyngeal tubercle is a part of the <a href="occipital%20bone">occipital bone</a> of the <a href="head">head</a> and <a href="neck">neck</a>. It is located on the lower surface of the <a href="basilar%20part%20of%20occipital%20bone">basilar part of occipital bone</a>. It is the site of attachment of the <a href="pharyngeal%20raphe">pharyngeal raphe</a>.
Structure.
The pharyngeal tubercle is located on the lower surface of the <a href="basilar%20part%20of%20occipital%20bone">basilar part of occipital bone</a>. This about 1 cm anterior to the <a href="foramen%20magnum">foramen magnum</a>.
Function.
The pharyngeal tubercle gives attachment to the fibrous <a href="raphe">raphe</a> of the <a href="pharynx">pharynx</a>, also known as the <a href="pharyngeal%20raphe">pharyngeal raphe</a>. This connects with the <a href="superior%20pharyngeal%20constrictor%20muscle">superior pharyngeal constrictor muscle</a>.
